H0.text: How many pennies were in a British pre-decimal pound? 120; 200; 204; or 240. 120

H1.text: How many pennies were in a British pre-decimal pound? 120; 200; 204; or 240. 200

H2.text: How many pennies were in a British pre-decimal pound? 120; 200; 204; or 240. 204

H3.text: How many pennies were in a British pre-decimal pound? 120; 200; 204; or 240. 240

A4.text: Before decimalisation in 1971, the pound was divided into 20 shillings, and each shilling into 12 pence, making 240 pence to the pound.

A5.text: The Tower Pound (5,400 grains, 349.9 g) of 92.5% silver minted into 240 pennies.
